info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 6 at 10:31AM CDT by NWS Little Rock AR
info.description:
...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Arkansas...
Saline River Near Rye affecting Cleveland, Drew, Ashley and Bradley Counties.
For the Saline River...including Benton, Rye...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Saline River near Rye.
* WHEN...From late Tuesday night until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Railroad Bridge across the river east of Warren effected. State Highway 8 in Eastern Bradley County may be flooded. State Highway 8 Bridge at Longview between Ashley and Bradley counties and numerous county roads along the river flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 20.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Wednesday morning and continue rising to 29.0 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts.
Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk
Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 1045 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE

area.areaDesc: Ashley, AR; Bradley, AR; Cleveland, AR; Drew, AR
